title: Tropical Storm Debby may bring  catastrophic  flooding to South Carolina amid  multiday deluge
message:
SOUTH CAROLINA (WBTV) - The South Carolina Emergency Management Division is monitoring Tropical Storm Debby as forecasters predict the storm will move “very slowly” across the state this week, leading to potentially historic rainfall.
Key local and state agencies have been notified to be ready to respond if the need arises, SCEMD officials announced Monday.
Our experts with the National Hurricane Center believe flooding to be catastrophic for many parts of South Carolina.
Take no chances with this storm.”According to the National Hurricane Center, up to 30 inches of rain is expected through Saturday morning across the coastal plain of South Carolina and southeast of North Carolina, possibly resulting in “catastrophic” flooding.

title: Opinion : Why there is no such thing as a  natural  disaster
message:
Charting a safer, more resilient course means first acknowledging that there is no such thing as a “natural disaster.” The word “natural” implies these events are entirely out of our control, thereby absolving us of the responsibility to prepare and reduce risk from natural hazards.
When we destroy and degrade much of the natural world, we make communities more vulnerable to disasters.
Without the storage capacity these natural systems provide, the risk of devastating floods and landslides increases.
Anita van Breda - WWFNature is fundamental to supporting life on Earth, adapting to a changing climate and reducing disaster risk.
In the wake of Hurricane Stan in 2005, Guatemala and Mexico diversified their farming systems to improve resilience and reduce future disaster risk.

title: Tropical storm Debby expected to intensify into hurricane , poses threat to Florida gulf coast
message:

title: Hurricane Debby takes aim at Florida Gulf Coast , expected to slog up East Coast
message:
(Reuters) - Hurricane Debby is expected to slam into the Big Bend region of Florida's Gulf Coast by midday on Monday before slowly crossing the state, causing potentially dangerous storm surges and catastrophic flooding, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
The hurricane center forecast life-threatening conditions, including storm surges up to 10 feet (3 meters) in some areas.
"This is going to be the story of this storm," said Jamie Rhome, the deputy director of the hurricane center.
The eye of Debby would move across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and reach the Florida Big Bend coast by midday on Monday, the hurricane center added.
Debby was then expected to move slowly across northern Florida and southern Georgia on Monday and Tuesday, it said.

"This is going to result in a prolonged extreme rainfall event with potential for catastrophic flooding across coastal portions of Georgia, South Carolina, even extending up into North Carolina," he said.
Florida governor Ron DeSantis also warned of "significant" flooding over the coming days, and said the state had already seen storm surge and some water rising.
The storm will probably cause catastrophic flooding with "potentially historic heavy rainfall" when Debby moves northeast across Georgia and South Carolina over the next few days, the NHC said.

title: FIRST ALERT : Debby now a hurricane ,  catastrophic  flooding possible in parts of SC
message:

Debby will meander through South Carolina this week.
That’s the highest risk issued in South Carolina since Hurricane Florence in 2018.
Hurricane conditions are expected in the hurricane warningarea by early Monday, with tropical storm conditions beginningovernight.
Tropical storm conditions are expected along the coast ofSouth Carolina within the tropical storm warning area lateMonday night.

title: Hurricane Debby makes landfall along Florida coast as Category 1 storm
message:
Hurricane Debby made landfall near Steinhatchee on the Florida coast early Monday morning bringing with it the potential for record-setting rains, and life-threatening storm surge.
Hurricane Debby is likely to stall off the coast of South Carolina on Wednesday, creating a major flooding issue for the state.
Flooding could last through Friday and is expected to be especially severe in low-lying areas near the coast, including Savannah, Georgia; Hilton Head, South Carolina; and Charleston, South Carolina.
“This is going to a significant storm,” Savannah Mayor Van.
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.

title: Tropical Storm Debby strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane as it heads toward Florida | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
By KIMBERLY CHANDLER and CHRISTOPHER O’MEARA Associated PressTAMPA, Fla. (AP) — Tropical Storm Debby strengthened into a Category 1 hurricane as it approached Florida on Sunday evening, according to the national weather service.
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.
Forecasters warned heavy amounts of rain from Debby could spawn catastrophic flooding in Florida, South Carolina and Georgia.
A tropical storm watch extended farther west into the Panhandle.
We’re doing everything that we need to be prepared to face a tropical storm,” Tampa Mayor Jane Castor said.

message:

title: Debby Intensifies Into Hurricane , Moves Toward Florida Gulf Coast
message:
Tropical Storm Debby intensified into a Category 1 hurricane as it continues to move toward the Big Bend stretch of Florida's Gulf Coast ahead of expected landfall Monday (August 5) morning, CBS News reports.
Debby is the fourth named storm reported during Atlantic hurricane season, the National Hurricane Center announced on Saturday (August 3).
The agency predicted Debby would bring drenching rain and coastal flooding, which would begin Sunday (August 4) night.
"There is a danger of life-threatening storm surge along portions of the Gulf Coast of Florida, with 6 to 10 feet of inundation above ground level expected somewhere between Ochlockonee River to Yankeetown late tonight and Monday morning," the National Hurricane Center wrote at around 11:00 p.m.
"Residents in the Storm Surge Warning area should follow any advice given by local officials."

title: Storm Debby strengthens to hurricane en route for Florida
message:

title: Hurricane Slams Florida After Gaining Fury in Warm Waters
message:
Hurricane Debby slammed into Florida southeast of Tallahassee as a Category 1 storm after intensifying over warm waters, the latest evidence that this will be a robust season for tropical cyclones.
Months of record warm water across the Atlantic has raised alarm that 2024 would be a very hurricane active season.
Debby is already the second storm to make landfall in the US this year following Beryl, which struck eastern Texas last month and caused a massive power outage.
A year ago, Hurricane Idalia made landfall in the Big Bend area as a Category 3 hurricane.
Photo: Protective measures at a business ahead of Hurricane Debby in Cedar Key, Florida, US, on Aug. 4.

title: As storm Debby strengthens , US southeast braces for  historic  rainfall
message:
A man checks on his neighborhood as high winds, rain and storm surge from Hurricane Debby inundate Cedar Key, Florida (JOE RAEDLE)At least four people were killed as Tropical Storm Debby swept over Florida on Monday, threatening southeastern US states with record-breaking rainfall and potentially catastrophic flooding.
Florida Governor Ron DeSantis also warned of "significant" flooding over the coming days, and said the state had already seen storm surge and some water rising.

Storm surge warnings are in effect in parts of the three states, indicating "life-threatening inundation, from rising water moving inland from the coastline."
The storm will probably cause catastrophic flooding with "potentially historic heavy rainfall" when Debby moves northeast across Georgia and South Carolina over the next few days, the NHC said.

title: Major flooding possible in SC as Hurricane Debby is forecast to drench Columbia area
message:
Major flooding possible in SC as Hurricane Debby is forecast to drench Columbia areaHurricane Debby made landfall in the U.S. on Monday, and will move north toward the Columbia area of South Carolina, where a flood watch has been issued, according to the National Weather Service.
A flood watch was issued in the Midlands as Hurricane Debby is forecast to bring excessive rain as it approaches from the south.
As of 5 a.m. Monday, the Hurricane Debby was moving northeast at 10 mph, and had maximum sustained winds of 75 mph, according to the National Hurricane Center.
Debby is expected to weaken as it moves over land Monday and through the night, according to the National Hurricane Center.
As of Sunday night, Debby’s winds are not expected to be a major threat to the Columbia area, the National Weather Service said.

The storm made landfall as a Category 1 storm near Steinhatchee, a tiny community in northern Florida of less than 1,000 residents on Florida’s Gulf Coast.
The storm made landfall in one of the least populated areas of Florida, but forecasters warned heavy rain could spawn catastrophic flooding in Florida, South Carolina and Georgia.
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.
The sparsely populated Big Bend region in the Florida Panhandle also was hit last year by Hurricane Idalia, which made landfall as a Category 3 hurricane.

title: Hurricane Debby makes landfall in northern Florida as Category 1 storm
message:
HORSESHOE BEACH, Fla. (AP) — Tropical Storm Debby slammed Florida with catastrophic flooding and was blamed for at least four deaths, with Georgia and South Carolina next in line as the system rips across the southeastern United States.
The tropical storm was moving slowly, covering roads with water and contributing to at least four deaths.
Vice President Kamala Harris has postponed a scheduled trip to Georgia amid the ongoing effects of Tropical Storm Debby.
In South Carolina, Charleston County Interim Emergency Director Ben Webster called Debby a “historic and potentially unprecedented event” three times in a 90-second briefing Monday morning.
North Carolina and South Carolina have dealt with three catastrophic floods from tropical systems in the past nine years, all causing more than $1 billion in damage.

title: Catfish in driveway  as Hurricane Debby slams Florida ; video
message:
A St. Petersburg, Fla., resident on Sunday shared footage showing catfish floundering in his yard during extensive flooding caused by Hurricane Debby.
As of Monday morning, Hurricane Debby hade made landfall along the Gulf Coast and was causing extensive flooding that seemed to flush fish from area waterways.
x.comCiarletta posted two videos showing catfish wriggling in shallow water outside his home.
Ciarletta assumed that the catfish were flushed onto his neighborhood streets via flooded storm drains.

title: Maps show Hurricane Debby path and forecast
message:
Tropical Storm Debby was barreling across northern Florida on Monday morning after making landfall over the state's Big Bend coast as a Category 1 hurricane.
Even with the slight dip in intensity, Debby was forecast to bring dangerous storm surge to parts of the Gulf Coast of Florida through Monday afternoon.
Storm surge threats gradually lessened as the hours passed after Debby's landfall, with forecasters saying by the afternoon that peak surge in that region would look more like 3 to 5 feet.
The National Hurricane Center published maps on Monday illustrating the storm surge forecast.
Coastal places as far south as Bonita Beach could see heavy rainfall coupled with storm surge for the next several days as a result of the tropical storm.

title: Hurricane Debby makes landfall in Florida , but it not done
message:
Hurricane Debby made landfall in Florida on Monday morning and continued to track inland while weakening to a tropical storm.
The National Hurricane Center said Debby, the second hurricane of 2024 in the Atlantic, moved onshore around 6 a.m. CDT Monday near Steinhatchee, Fla., in the Big Bend region.
The hurricane center estimated Debby’s winds to be around 80 mph at the time of landfall.
Debby’s winds had fallen from 80 mph to 70 mph, making it a strong tropical storm, the hurricane center said.

title: Hurricane Debby Makes Landfall In Florida | NewsTalk WMEQ
message:
Hurricane Debby downgraded to a tropical storm at around 11:00 a.m. local time, according to the National Weather Center.
---Debby made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane with sustained wind speeds up to 80 MPH on the Big Bend stretch of Florida's Gulf Coast at 7:00 a.m.
ET on Monday (August 5), the National Hurricane Center announced.
"Hurricane #Debby Advisory 12A: Debby Just Inland in the Florida Big Bend Region.
"Latest on Hurricane Debby for #Pinellas: Some breaks in the rainfall now, but more rain bands expected throughout the day.

title: Hurricane Debby could bring heavy rain to much of NC this week . Here when and where .
message:
Hurricane Debby could bring heavy rain to much of NC this week.
Debby will move offshore from Georgia or South Carolina into the Atlantic on Thursday morning, forecasters say, before making landfall again in South Carolina sometime Friday.
From there it’s expected to move north into North Carolina, still a tropical storm.
Flash flooding is possible in all but extreme western North Carolina this week as what becomes Tropical Storm Debby moves slowly over the Southeast.
Along the coast, dangerous storm surge and wind impacts are expected from Florida all the way to North Carolina through midweek.

title: How did Tropical Storm Debby affect Naples , Fort Myers , Southwest Florida area ?
message:
Scenes from Fort Myers Beach on Sunday, Aug. 4, 2024.
The outer portions of Tropical Storm Debby flooded coastal streets and other areas including Estero Boulevard on Fort Myers Beach.
Heavy rains and storm surge from Tropical Storm Debby have caused flooding on Fort Myers Beach properties, including Nervous Nellie's, on Sunday.
Scenes from clean up efforts on Fort Myers Beach on Monday, Aug. 5, 2024.
Contributing: Mark H. Bickel, J. Kyle Foster, Liz Freeman, Mickenzie Hannon, Cindy McCurry Ross, Andrew West, Laura LaydenThis article originally appeared on Fort Myers News-Press: Tropical Storm Debby's impact on Naples, Fort Myers, Sanibel, islands

title: East Coast prepares for Hurricane Debby ;  Deadpool & Wolverine  sets record
message:
The National Hurricane Center of Miami says Debby is located about 60 miles northwest of Cedar Key, Florida, with maximum sustained winds of 80 mph.
The hurricane center says Debby is expected to make landfall Monday morning.
BANGKOK (AP) — Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 stock index has lost 12.4% in the latest bout of sell-offs that are jolting world markets.
